noteParagraph.text: In this class, the term "vehicle" means all vehicles except those restricted to one of the following types of vehicles: rail vehicles, waterborne vessels, aircraft, space vehicles, hand carts, cycles, animal-drawn vehicles, and sledges; these types are to be found in the relevant classes . Thus, the term "vehicle" embraces vehicular characteristics which are common to more than one of the above-listed types. It also embraces certain characteristics restricted to automobile or road or cross-country trailers. The following exceptions to the above should be noted:
Sub-classes and embrace all vehicle wheels and tyres, except wheels for roller skates , wheels for model railway vehicles , and special adaptations of wheels or tyres for aircraft .
Sub-class embraces the repairing of, and the connection of valves to, inflatable elastic bodies in general, and in this respect it is not limited to vehicles.
Sub-class embraces certain electric equipment of all electrically-propelled vehicles.
Sub-class embraces certain power supply equipment for, but external to, any kind of electrically-propelled vehicle.
Sub-class relates to all kinds of vehicles, except the servicing of rail locomotives , ground equipment for aircraft , or cleaning apparatus peculiar to waterborne vessels , .

Sub-class includes brake control systems of general applicability, and in this respect it is not limited to vehicles. It also includes rail-vehicle power-brake systems and some other features of rail-vehicle brake systems.
Attention is drawn to the note following the title of class .

titlePart.entryReference: making wheels or wheel parts by rolling , by forging, hammering, or pressing

titlePart.text: Wheels with wire or other tension spokes
Attaching spokes to rim or hub
Attaching spokes to rim or hub
Disc wheels, i.e. wheels with load-supporting disc body
with a single disc body integral with rim
with a single disc body not integral with rim
with disc body formed by two or more axially- spaced discs
Wheels, spokes, disc bodies, rims, hubs, wholly or predominantly made of non-metallic material
Wheel cover discs, rings, or the like, for ornamenting, protecting, or obscuring, wholly or in part, the wheel body, rim, or hub
in the form of sleeves or rings concentric with wheel axis
with means limiting relative lateral movements between hub and remainder of wheel
in rings concentric with wheel axis
Units comprising multiple wheels arranged side by side
Wheels having more than one rim or capable of carrying more than one tyre
Units of separate wheels mounted for independent or coupled rotation
Wheels with a rim capable of carrying more than one tyre
Wheels with more than one rim mounted on a single wheel body
Arrangements of balancing mechanisms enabling a uniform distribution of load to the tyres
Wheels or wheel attachments designed for increasing traction
titlePart.entryReference: tyres, non-skid devices temporarily attachable to resilient tyres or resiliently-tyred wheels

titlePart.text: with spade lugs axially displaced relatively to the tread surface of the tyre
involving gearing, e.g. gear pinions acting upon threaded shafts on the spade lugs
with resiliently-mounted shoes, e.g. on a spider
connected by links to the hub
Tread bands or rings for fairing lugs when travelling on the road
Auxiliary wheels or rings with traction-increasing surface attachable to the main wheel body
Wheels not otherwise provided for or having characteristics specified in one of the sub-groups of this group
convertible, e.g. from road wheel to rail wheel
Wheels specially designed for alternative use on road and rail
with compartments for fluid, packing, or loading material
with lubricating passages, channels, or reservoirs

titlePart.entryReference: capable of carrying more than one tyre
multiple rims on single wheel body

titlePart.text: characterised by means for attaching spokes
characterised by the form of tyre-seat or flange, e.g. corrugated

titlePart.entryReference: attaching rims resiliently to wheel body

titlePart.text: by split or other expansible ring devices
by bayonet-joint, screw-thread, or like attachments
by screws, bolts, pins, or clips
by devices arranged to permit variation of axial position of rim relative to wheel body for track- width adjustment
Rims built-up of several main parts
Segmented rims, e.g. with segments arranged in sections
Rims with dismountable flange rings, seat rings, or lock rings
Split flange rings, e.g. transversely split
Connecting equipment for overlapping the slot
Arrangement of recesses enabling the flange ring to be slipped over the rim body
Seat rings for the tyre bead part, e.g. split
Locking means for flange rings or seat rings
Arrangement of screw, bolts, or shouldered pins
Other appurtenances, e.g. for sealing the component parts enabling the use of tubeless tyres
adapted to be rotatably arranged on axle
adapted to be fixed on axle
Apparatus or tools for mounting wheels or parts thereof
Apparatus or tools for mounting or dismounting wheels
Apparatus or tools for assembling or disassembling wheels
for tightening or straightening wire spokes in situ
for removing or attaching cover discs, hub caps, or the like
Dead axles, i.e. not transmitting torque
Couplings between axle parts or sections

titlePart.entryReference: units comprising multiple wheels arranged side by side

titlePart.text: the wheels being integral with solid axles
the wheels being rigidly attached to solid axles
the wheels being integral with, or rigidly attached to, hollow axles
the hollow axles being rotatable around fixed axles
the wheels being individually rotatable around the axles
Axles with a fixed wheel and a loose wheel

titlePart.entryReference: wheels, wheel attachments, or tyre attachments, designed for increasing traction ,
road surface conditioning to prevent slipperiness

titlePart.text: Vehicle fittings for scattering or dispensing material in front of its wheels
the material being granular, e.g. sand
titlePart.entryReference: combined control of sanding apparatus and brakes of rail vehicles

titlePart.text: the dispensing being effected by mechanical means
the dispensing being effected by fluid means
the dispensing being controlled electrically or electromagnetically
the material being sheet-like or web-like
